item.title: Michael add a quote by Cormac McCarthy
Michael add a quote by Aldous Huxley
item.description: "Chastity—the most unnatural of all the sexual perversions, he added parenthetically, out of [author:Remy de Gourmont|78190]." -- Aldous Huxley

item.title: Michael add a quote by Matt Groening
item.description: "Love is a snowmobile racing across the tundra and then suddenly it flips over, pinning you underneath. At night, the ice weasels come." -- Matt Groening

item.title: Michael add a quote by Graham Greene
item.description: "You cannot conceive, nor can I, of the appalling strangeness of the mercy of God." -- Graham Greene

item.title: Michael add a quote by Graham Greene
item.description: "Time has its revenges, but revenge seems so often sour. Wouldn’t we all do better not trying to understand, accepting the fact that no human being will ever understand another, not a wife with a husband, nor a parent a child? Perhaps that’s why men have invented God – a being capable of understanding. " -- Graham Greene

item.title: Michael add a quote by Graham Greene
item.description: "I wrote at the start that this was a record of hate, and walking there beside Henry towards the evening glass of beer, I found the one prayer that seemed to serve the winter mood: O God, You've done enough, You've robbed me of enough, I'm too tired and old to learn to love, leave me alone forever." -- Graham Greene

item.title: Michael add a quote by Graham Greene
item.description: "I hate you, God. I hate you as though you actually exist." -- Graham Greene

item.title: Michael add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "In heaven, all the interesting people are missing." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Michael add a quote by Sam Harris
item.description: "The president of the United States has claimed, on more than one occasion, to be in dialogue with God. If he said that he was talking to God through his hairdryer, this would precipitate a national emergency. I fail to see how the addition of a hairdryer makes the claim more ridiculous or offensive." -- Sam Harris

item.title: Michael add a quote by Christopher Hitchens
item.description: "Many religions now come before us with ingratiating smirks and outspread hands, like an unctuous merchant in a bazaar. They offer consolation and solidarity and uplift, competing as they do in a marketplace. But we have a right to remember how barbarically they behaved when they were strong and were making an offer that people could not refuse." -- Christopher Hitchens

item.title: Michael add a quote by Jon Stewart
item.description: "Yes, reason has been a part of organized religion, ever since two nudists took dietary advice from a talking snake." -- Jon Stewart

item.title: Michael add a quote by Richard Dawkins
item.description: "Religion is about turning untested belief into unshakable truth through the power of institutions and the passage of time." -- Richard Dawkins

item.title: Michael add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "When his life was ruined, his family killed, his farm destroyed, Job knelt down on the ground and yelled up to the heavens, "Why god? Why me?" and the thundering voice of God answered, There's just something about you that pisses me off." -- Stephen King

item.title: Michael add a quote by Richard Dawkins
item.description: "The God of the Old Testament is arguably the most unpleasant character in all fiction: jealous and proud of it; a petty, unjust, unforgiving control-freak; a vindictive, bloodthirsty ethnic cleanser; a misogynistic, homophobic, racist, infanticidal, genocidal, filicidal, pestilential, megalomaniacal, sadomasochistic, capriciously malevolent bully." -- Richard Dawkins

item.title: Michael add a quote by Robert Anton Wilson
item.description: "The Bible tells us to be like God, and then on page after page it describes God as a mass murderer. This may be the single most important key to the political behavior of Western Civilization." -- Robert Anton Wilson

item.title: Michael add a quote by Jerry Seinfeld
item.description: "If a book about failures doesn't sell, is it a success?" -- Jerry Seinfeld

item.title: Michael add a quote by Billy Sunday
item.description: "Going to church doesn’t make you a Christian any more than going to a garage makes you an automobile." -- Billy Sunday

item.title: Michael add a quote by Jules Renard
item.description: "I don't know if God exists, but it would be better for His reputation if He didn't." -- Jules Renard
